title: Deployment & Hosting
description: Deploy and manage your Firebase projects

cards.task: Initialize a new Firebase project in the current directory
cards.description: Starts an interactive setup wizard to configure Firebase services (Hosting, Functions, Firestore, etc.) for your project.
cards.whenToUse: When setting up Firebase in a new or existing project directory.
scenarios: New project: Setting up Firebase for a fresh web application
Adding services: Adding Firestore or Functions to an existing project
Configuration: Generating firebase.json and other config files

cards.description: Deploys all configured services (Hosting, Functions, Firestore rules, etc.) to your Firebase project.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to push all local changes to production.
scenarios: Full deployment: Pushing all changes after major updates
Initial launch: Deploying a project for the first time
Sync everything: Ensuring all services are up to date

cards.description: Deploys only the static hosting files, skipping Functions, Firestore rules, and other services.
cards.whenToUse: When you only changed frontend files and want a faster deployment.
scenarios: Frontend update: Deploying only HTML/CSS/JS changes
Quick fix: Pushing a hotfix without redeploying functions
Selective deploy: Avoiding function cold starts from redeployment

cards.description: Deploys only Cloud Functions, skipping hosting and other services.
cards.whenToUse: When you've only modified backend functions.
scenarios: Backend update: Deploying API changes without touching frontend
Function fix: Pushing a bug fix to a specific function
Faster iteration: Skipping hosting during function development

cards.task: Deploy a specific Cloud Function by name
cards.description: Deploys only the specified function, leaving other functions untouched.
cards.whenToUse: When you've changed only one function and want the fastest possible deployment.
scenarios: Single function fix: Deploying a hotfix to one function
Targeted update: Updating only the function you're working on
Minimize disruption: Avoiding redeployment of stable functions

cards.task: Set the active Firebase project for this directory
cards.description: Sets which Firebase project to use for commands in the current directory.
cards.whenToUse: When working with multiple Firebase projects or switching between staging/production.
scenarios: Project switching: Changing from development to production project
Multi-project setup: Selecting which project to deploy to
Environment management: Switching between staging and prod

cards.task: List all Firebase projects you have access to
cards.description: Shows all Firebase projects associated with your logged-in account.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to find a project ID or see available projects.
scenarios: Project discovery: Finding the project ID you need
Account overview: Seeing all projects under your account
Troubleshooting: Verifying you have access to a project

cards.description: Creates a new Firebase project with the specified ID.
cards.whenToUse: When starting a new application that needs Firebase services.
scenarios: New application: Creating a project for a new app
Environment setup: Creating separate staging/production projects
Client project: Setting up a new project for a client
